intro: Cracca pumila, commonly known as the dwarf cracca, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia. Cracca pumila is often found in tundra and mountainous environments where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems. Its medicinal properties have been historically utilized in traditional herbal remedies.
